medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute abdominal pain with fever and diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced acute onset of abdominal pain the prior evening. Has had diarrhea over the last several days, noted fever, chills, and positive nausea/vomiting. Vomit is non-bilious and non-bloody. Pain is localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and suprapubic area, does not radiate, and has no relieving factors. Pain is moderate in intensity.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Hypertension 2. Hyperlipidemia 3. Metastatic prostate cancer, Status post prostatectomy.
